list_definition.definition: a covered dish in which food is both cooked and served
the food cooked in a casserole

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I’ve made a lamb casserole for dinner.

list_ex_of_english: The rabbit is cooked in a casserole with oil, vinegar, onions and garlic.
The oysters are baked in the shell or can be made in a small casserole dish or au gratin dish.
In the kitchen there was a small casserole where there were the same white beans.
The cake can be served either still warm directly from the casserole or left to cool to room temperature.
This same firm had tens of thousands of tins of cooked casserole stew.
It can also be used to cook kugels, casseroles, pasta dishes, meat, and chicken.
There is nothing wrong with a good stew or casserole but the ingredients in terms of cost and control are so mixed that we have a genuine problem.
The casserole is made of rice, ground liver, butter or margarine, syrup, eggs, onion, and raisins.
